content.description: Two identical positively charged particles are released from rest in the region shown in the figure. The lines in the figure are equipotentials. Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> moves from Point <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math> to Point <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, while Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> moves from Point <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> to Point <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>. No external forces do work on the particles during the motion. Which of the following claims correctly compares the final kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to the final kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and provides a correct justification?
content.question: Relation Justification A <math alttext="K sub 1 is less than K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> The kinetic energy is greater for Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> because the final potential energy is zero, which means that all the energy is converted to kinetic energy. B <math alttext="K sub 1 is less than K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> The kinetic energy is greater for Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> because the distance traveled by Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is less than that traveled by Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. C <math alttext="K sub 1 equals K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> The kinetic energy is equal for both particles because the potential difference between points <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math> and <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is equal to the potential difference between points <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>. D <math alttext="K sub 1 equals K sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> The kinetic energy is equal for both particles because they both travel perpendicular to the equipotential lines.
